oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to Sarah Bell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page letter from Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to Sarah Bell. He has traveled from Milliken's Bend, marching down the river twenty miles below Vicksburg to the [grand gulf].; They were attacked May 1 during the Vicksburg Campaign. The Union soldiers were able to capture one battery, though the "rebels" gained ground locating in a dense thicket with hills and cane fields which tired down the Union soldiers.
